Uses of Class
obr.AtomConjunction

Uses of AtomConjunction in obr
 

Subclasses of AtomConjunction in obr
 class AtomicRule
          Represents an atomic rule.
A rule is an atom conjunction which adds the notions of "body" and "head".
An atomic rule contains only one atom in its head.
 

Methods in obr that return AtomConjunction
 AtomConjunction AtomConjunction.clone()
          Clones the atom conjunction.
Convenient method for cloneIn(new AtomConjunction()).
 AtomConjunction AtomConjunction.cloneIn(AtomConjunction copy)
          Clones the atom conjunction into a copy instance.
protected static AtomConjunction AtomicRule.extension(AtomConjunction H1, int atomRootID, boolean[] isLocallyUnifiable, int[] E)
          Extends an atom conjunction for the unification algorithm.
 AtomConjunction AtomicRule.getBody()
          Creates a new atom conjunction corresponding to the body of the rule.
 AtomConjunction AtomConjunction.subAtomConjunction(int beginAtomID, int endAtomID)
          Returns a new atom conjunction which is a clone of a subset of the current atom conjunction.
The two parameters will be used as the range of atoms to be used.
 

Methods in obr with parameters of type AtomConjunction
 void AtomConjunction.addAtom(moca.graphs.vertices.Vertex<java.lang.Object> atom, AtomConjunction source)
          Add an atom from another atom conjunction.
If the first parameter is not really an atom vertex, this method will silently fail.
 AtomConjunction AtomConjunction.cloneIn(AtomConjunction copy)
          Clones the atom conjunction into a copy instance.
static boolean AtomicRule.existUnification(AtomConjunction H1, AtomicRule R)
          Static method used to know if there exists a unification between the atom conjunction and the rule passed as parameters.
protected static AtomConjunction AtomicRule.extension(AtomConjunction H1, int atomRootID, boolean[] isLocallyUnifiable, int[] E)
          Extends an atom conjunction for the unification algorithm.
protected static boolean AtomicRule.localUnification(AtomConjunction H1, AtomicRule R, int[] existentialIndex)
          Checks if there is a unification between the head of the rule and the full atom conjunction passed as parameters.
